title.value: ARGV: 3D genome structure exploration using augmented reality
title.justification: The title clearly indicates the focus of the research paper, which is on the ARGV tool for exploring 3D genome structures using augmented reality.
title.quote: ARGV: 3D genome structure exploration using augmented reality

extractions.description: This paper presents ARGV, an augmented reality 3D genome viewer allowing users to visualize and manipulate chromosome structures on mobile devices, facilitating the exploration, storage, and sharing of 3D genome data.

type.justification: The paper describes the application and user testing of ARGV, an augmented reality tool for genome visualization, indicating an empirical study.
type.quote: We conducted a user study to evaluate the impact of ARGV as a teaching support tool for 3D genomics research and education.

name.justification: The research involves computational methods to analyze biological data, specifically in visualizing 3D genome structures, which falls under bioinformatics.
The paper outlines the use of augmented reality technology for viewing 3D genomic structures on mobile devices.
name.quote: ARGV, an augmented reality 3D genome viewer.

name.justification: The study focuses on the visualization of 3D genome structures, which is a central topic in genomics.
name.quote: ARGV enables the visualization and manipulation of annotated chromosome structures in an immersive environment.

name.justification: SuperRec is directly mentioned as the approach used for 3D chromatin modelling.
name.quote: we used the consensus-weighted MDS approach superRec for 3D chromatin modelling.

is_contributed.justification: SuperRec is used but not claimed as a contribution of this paper.
is_contributed.quote: we used the consensus-weighted MDS approach superRec for 3D chromatin modelling.

is_executed.justification: SuperRec is executed as part of their method to model 3D genome structures.
is_executed.quote: we used the consensus-weighted MDS approach superRec for 3D chromatin modelling.

is_compared.justification: The paper does not indicate a numerical comparison of SuperRec with other models, although it mentions other methods.
is_compared.quote: Though ensemble approaches, physical and statistical modelling approaches proposed in recent years are known to outperform multidimensional scaling (MDS) approaches for modelling small regions

referenced_paper_title.value: Large-scale 3D chromatin reconstruction from chromosomal contacts
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper title for SuperRec is given in the citations.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Large-scale 3D chromatin reconstruction from chromosomal contacts.

name.justification: The paper explicitly mentions utilizing 343 human Hi-C datasets from the GEO database.
name.quote: We downloaded 343 published human Hi-C datasets from the GEO database.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper does not reference a specific paper title for these datasets.

name.justification: Unity SDK is mentioned as part of the implementation environment for ARGV.
name.quote: We implemented all functions using the Unity SDK (2020.1.0a11).

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper does not reference a specific paper title for Unity SDK.

name.justification: ARKit is mentioned as part of the implementation environment for ARGV.
name.quote: We implemented all functions using... ARKit (4.1).

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper does not reference a specific paper title for ARKit.

name.justification: ARCore is mentioned as part of the implementation environment for ARGV.
name.quote: We implemented all functions using... ARCore (4.1).

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper does not reference a specific paper title for ARCore.
